intro: Hierochloe redolens var. altissima, commonly known as the tall sweetgrass, is a flowering plant species native to the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and fine, hair-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and along riverbanks. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, and it is often found in association with other wetland vegetation. The species is notable for its pleasant fragrance, which is released when the leaves are crushed.
